abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as unsatisfactory. Key lessons learned include: 1)
            Projects with highly politicized agencies such as National
            Electrification Administration, where the risk is high that
            even key operational personnel will be changed after general
            elections, should not be initiated shortly before such
            elections. Alternatively, commitments should be obtained
            from the borrower that key personnel will not be changed. 2)
            At the time of Board presentation, at least the first
            bidding document should be available. 3) A project
            implementation unit should be in place at the beginning of a
            project. The unit should be staffed adequately or the
            project director should be authorized to assign personnel
            from other departments for certain tasks. 4) Procurement
            should be based on a cautious assessment of the capability
            of the procurement agency. 5) Consultants who reside in the
            country should not be selected for assistance in
            procurement. 6) If there are indications that favoritism
            plays a role, then the Bank should consider getting out of
            the project at the first sign. 7) Small items such as
            hardware and tools should not be included in the list of
            material funded by the Bank projects if they can be
            purchased locally. 8) The Bank's procurement tasks
            should be shifted to the resident mission. 9) Time schedules
            should be based on conservative assumptions regarding the
            duration of bid evaluation and delivery schedules.
